result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam K. Rueckert in court and by Attorney Gillion Parham.  Counsel is awaiting test results.  State indicates that results may not be available until February or March of 2023.  Court admonishes defendant of bond conditions in place.  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2023 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam K. Rueckert in court and by Attorney Gillion Parham.  Counsel is still awaiting blood results.  DA informs Court the lab results are approx. 8 months out from date of violation.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam K. Rueckert in court and by Attorney Gillion Parham.  Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Lab results pending and mid-July return date requested.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Request for Adjournment or, in the Alternative, a Zoom Appearance
Reset Arraignment from 4-20-2022 to on April 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm as is a Branch 3 case.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adam K Rueckert appeared in court, Attorney Gillion Parham for Adam K Rueckert appeared in court. Clerk: EZ.  State prepared to proceed with Preliminary Hearing with Officer Bloch of GPD.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
22R 005400; Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #14654 on 3/11/22
Maintain absolute sobriety; Not possess/consume any controlled substance without valid prescription

Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adam K Rueckert appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Edgar A Beltran for Adam K Rueckert appeared in court.
